channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Israel’s Looming Plans for Gaza City, and a Surge in Stalking in Women’s Sports

item.title: Far fewer Canadians are visiting the U.S. this year, new numbers show

item.title: Zelensky, Back From Washington, Projects More Confidence in Peace Talks
item.description: The Ukrainian leader returned with a U.S. commitment to participate in security guarantees for Kyiv in a postwar settlement.

item.title: One Sentence in the Constitution Is Causing America Huge Problems
item.description: An amendment that can help save our democracy.

item.title: Women in Indian Sports Sweat for Their Share of a Booming Market
item.description: Female athletes are using social media to increase viewership and seek better sponsorship deals in a field long dominated by men.

item.title: How Tiffany Trump’s Husband Benefited From Proximity to Power
item.description: A Times investigation found that Michael Boulos and his family benefited financially from proximity to his in-laws for years.

item.title: A Huge Cave in Kentucky Was a Smelly Disaster. Now It’s Spectacular.
item.description: Hidden River Cave was once filled with heavy metals and sewage that made the surrounding town smell awful. After a cleanup, it became a tourist draw.

item.title: Brazil-U. S. Talks on Mining Rare Earth Minerals Are Complicated by Trump’s Tariffs
item.description: Tensions between President Trump and Brazil’s leader could derail a promising alliance to unlock the world’s second largest reserve of the minerals.
